meanings.definition: The quality or state of being weak or delicate.
meanings.sent1: Her frailness made it difficult for her to carry heavy bags.
meanings.sent2: The frailness of the flower petals made them easy to crush.
meanings.sent3: Despite her frailness, she managed to climb the tree and rescue the cat.
meanings.sent4: The frailness of the old bridge was evident as it creaked under the weight of the car.
meanings.sent5: The frailness of the thread was evident as it snapped with the slightest pull.

meanings.sent1: His frailness in resisting temptation led him to make poor choices.
meanings.sent2: The frailness of his body prevented him from participating in strenuous activities.
meanings.sent3: His frailness in the face of adversity surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The frailness of his argument was exposed when he couldn't provide any evidence.
meanings.sent5: The frailness of his character became apparent when he betrayed his friends.
